p: Inspired by the fabrication of amorphous solid conductor for LIBs, such as Li 3PO 4, Su and Tsuruoka proposed a plasma-assisted atomic layer deposition method to fabricate amorphous oxygen-deficient Mg 2.4P 2O 5.4 thin film in 2019 (Cengiz et al., 2019; Su et al., 2019). It exhibited an ionic conductivity of 1.6 × 10 −7 S cm −1 at 500°C. The hopping conduction of Mg ions in the disordered amorphous phosphate matrix was believed to result in the conductivity.
